div.head: Capitulum 9
Concerning the cause of the institution of baptism.
div.p: But the cause of the institution of baptism is an renewal of the mind, such that a person, who was made old through sin, is made new through the grace of baptism, which happens through the laying aside of vices and the gathering of virtues. For in this way one becomes a new person, when, having abolished sin, they are dressed in virtues. The abolition of sins drives away ugliness; the acquisition of virtue leads what is beautiful, and this is the thing (res) of this sacrament, namely the interior cleaning.

If it is asked, whether baptism opened heaven, because circumcision did not, we say, because neither baptism nor circumcision opened for us access to the kingdom, but rather the sacrifice of the Savior, which if it had been made during the time of circumcision, the people of that time would have entered into the kingdom. The thing therefore of this sacrament is justification.
